meaningMnemonic:
This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>change</kanji> so you'd think the verb version is "to change," but it's a bit more specific. This word means <vocabulary>to change form</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to transform</vocabulary>.

化ける means to change into something else, usually in a surprising and magical way. It's often used in stories where animals or spirits take on human forms. It can also describe transformations in real life that are so dramatic they feel unreal.
